column4: Hi, my 7.1 sudenly started to move with mouse cursor when i switch applications with alt-tab etc.... please how to disable this atrocity? thx
7.10, not 7.1, and do you mean the focus follows the windows, or the mouse cursor arbitrarily moves?
when I switch between 2 windows (doesnt matter which) curtsoc moves to upper right corner
Gnome or KDE, and do you have Compiz or Beryl active?
Gnome, compiz fusion
disable desktop effects. Does it still happen?
disabling desktop effects also disables this
do you have compizconfig-settings-manager installed?
yes
backup your config under prefs in ccsm and reset to defaults. Does the problem still happen>?
mmt
no
then restore your settings, and check through the window preferences and see if there's a specific setting misconfigured. You've successsfully determined it's your config causing the problem
I would start with advanced search in ccsm and search "cursor" or "mouse"
thanks very much I do not have fine tuned profile in compiz so I will easily tune the default one
yeah, that's the easiest way :)
nevertheless I find it quite strange, becuase there was nothing like this happening yeasterday...

that is strange. See if it happens again, but back up your settings each time you make a change in ccsm. That way, when it does happen, you can use compdiff and see what's being corrupted in your compiz settings file
if you get that level of information, report a launchpad bug
might my previous expewriments with KDE4 coused this (I doubt, but thats only reasonable explanation I can think of...)
it's possible, I suppose
well thx for support and have a nice day:)
